column608:
Experiment Summary

Title: Short text to describe your experiment.

Requesting Team: Please insert here your Lilli team name.

Main Stakeholders: List here the main stakeholders we should maintain informed during the experiment

Problem Definition: Please define the core problem or challenge that the proposed experiment seeks to address based on the end-user perspective.

Additional Context / Background information (optional): Include here any relevant theories or prior research
ðŸ”¬
    
Experiment
                          
Experiment Objectives
Main hypothesis: Please define the hypothesis (es) that will be tested through the proposed experiment. There should be clear a statement of the assumption that will happen when we test an experiment. î‚Example of hypothesis: Using Knowledge Graph when adding memory to Lilli prompts will lead to a improvement of XX% in accuracy compared to the current GPT Turbo 3.5 model we currently have on Lilli)

Expected effect (optional): Describe what is the expected outcome of the proposed experiment.

Risky Assumptions to mitigate (optional): Define any risky assumptions we should focus when doing the experiment.

Specific model/framework (optional): Describe any model, frameworks or tools that you want to be tested on this experiment.

Success Metrics: Describe what are the main measurable metrics that will be used to evaluate the outcomes of the experiment. This metrics will be the guide to observe, quantify, and analyze the effects of the experimental interventions we will be running.

Learning goal: Define here what is that your team hope to learn from the experiment.

Scope
TBD

Team
Please provide the resources that you plan to align to this experiment, their capacity and allocation

Timeline

- Please provide when your team will be ready to start the 
  experiment
- Please provide when you expect the final end result of the requested experiment

Dataset (optional)
- Please provide any dataset or important information that can 
  help on the experiment.

Additional Information (optional)
Please feel free to share any additional information, documents, attachments and comments that you believe are going to be useful when doing the experiment.
column609:
Description

[Use gherkin syntax to describe the user story. e.g., As a user, I want to automatically format the alignment on my slide so that I donâ€™t have to manually space objects and shapes, saving time and effort]
â€¢	context

Technical Implementation Details
[Describe relevant technical details such as Lilliâ€™s components modified within the scope of this story. E.g., Share new request and response examples for universal search API, explain the technical points changed in Reranker.]

Acceptance criteria
Please see acceptance criteria reference examples below. The QA team expects POs to provide an acceptance criteria as part of the story template.
[Example]
â€¢	[ ] The user can prompt Lilli to apply alignment formatting on their current slide
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations are automatically applied
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations adhere to McKinsey One Firm guidelines
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations do not take more than 10 seconds to be applied]
â€¢	[ ] Data-specific requirements (Data Acceptance Criteria)
â€¢	[ ] Functional requirements
â€¢	[ ] Quality benchmarks

Required inputs for QA to start
Use cases
[User diagrams, text and/or other representations to explain how this story will be used by end users, including benchmark results, leveraging expert inputs as needed]
[Optional field incase specific use cases different form ones described in Description exist]

Sample Prompt and Expected Results
[List a sample of prompts adequate to use and resulting outputs]

Dependencies and Feature/Product Risk
[List of as-is features that can be potentially impacted as a result of this story implementation]
[This is to ensure regression testing for story covers features that might be impacted]
[E.g., New flag implemented to manager parsing version through unleash that have impact in the visibility of the recommended icon feature of know docs.]
Data Ingested (when applicable)
[Identify the list of new data ingested]

Main hypothesis: Please define the hypothesis (es) that will be tested through the proposed experiment. column609:
Description

[Use gherkin syntax to describe the user story. e.g., As a user, I want to automatically format the alignment on my slide so that I donâ€™t have to manually space objects and shapes, saving time and effort]
â€¢	context

Technical Implementation Details
[Describe relevant technical details such as Lilliâ€™s components modified within the scope of this story. E.g., Share new request and response examples for universal search API, explain the technical points changed in Reranker.]

Acceptance criteria
Please see acceptance criteria reference examples below. The QA team expects POs to provide an acceptance criteria as part of the story template.
[Example]
â€¢	[ ] The user can prompt Lilli to apply alignment formatting on their current slide
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations are automatically applied
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations adhere to McKinsey One Firm guidelines
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations do not take more than 10 seconds to be applied]
â€¢	[ ] Data-specific requirements (Data Acceptance Criteria)
â€¢	[ ] Functional requirements
â€¢	[ ] Quality benchmarks

Required inputs for QA to start
Use cases
[User diagrams, text and/or other representations to explain how this story will be used by end users, including benchmark results, leveraging expert inputs as needed]
[Optional field incase specific use cases different form ones described in Description exist]

Sample Prompt and Expected Results
[List a sample of prompts adequate to use and resulting outputs]

Dependencies and Feature/Product Risk
[List of as-is features that can be potentially impacted as a result of this story implementation]
[This is to ensure regression testing for story covers features that might be impacted]
[E.g., New flag implemented to manager parsing version through unleash that have impact in the visibility of the recommended icon feature of know docs.]

[Identify the list of new data ingested]

Main hypothesis: Please define the hypothesis (es) that will be tested through the proposed experiment. There should be clear a statement of the assumption that will happen when we test an experiment. î‚Example of hypothesis: Using Knowledge Graph when adding memory to Lilli prompts will lead to a improvement of XX% in accuracy compared to the current GPT Turbo 3.5 model we currently have on Lilli)

Expected effect (optional): Describe what is the expected outcome of the proposed experiment.

Risky Assumptions to mitigate (optional): Define any risky assumptions we should focus when doing the experiment.

Specific model/framework (optional): Describe any model, frameworks or tools that you want to be tested on this experiment.

Success Metrics: Describe what are the main measurable metrics that will be used to evaluate the outcomes of the experiment. This metrics will be the guide to observe, quantify, and analyze the effects of the experimental interventions we will be running.

Learning goal: Define here what is that your team hope to learn from the experiment.

Description

[Use gherkin syntax to describe the user story. e.g., As a user, I want to automatically format the alignment on my slide so that I donâ€™t have to manually space objects and shapes, saving time and effort]
â€¢	context

Technical Implementation Details
[Describe relevant technical details such as Lilliâ€™s components modified within the scope of this story. E.g., Share new request and response examples for universal search API, explain the technical points changed in Reranker.]

Acceptance criteria
Please see acceptance criteria reference examples below. The QA team expects POs to provide an acceptance criteria as part of the story template.
[Example]
â€¢	[ ] The user can prompt Lilli to apply alignment formatting on their current slide
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations are automatically applied
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations adhere to McKinsey One Firm guidelines
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations do not take more than 10 seconds to be applied]
â€¢	[ ] Data-specific requirements (Data Acceptance Criteria)
â€¢	[ ] Functional requirements

Sample Prompt and Expected Results
[List a sample of prompts adequate to use and resulting outputs]

Dependencies and Feature/Product Risk
[List of as-is features that can be potentially impacted as a result of this story implementation]
[This is to ensure regression testing for story covers features that might be impacted]

column608:
Experiment Summary

Title: Short text to describe your experiment.

Requesting Team: Please insert here your Lilli team name.

Main Stakeholders: List here the main stakeholders we should maintain informed during the experiment

Problem Definition: Please define the core problem or challenge that the proposed experiment seeks to address based on the end-user perspective.

Additional Context / Background information (optional): Include here any relevant theories or prior research
ðŸ”¬
    
Experiment
                          
Experiment Objectives
Main hypothesis: Please define the hypothesis (es) that will be tested through the proposed experiment. There should be clear a statement of the assumption that will happen when we test an experiment. î‚Example of hypothesis: Using Knowledge Graph when adding memory to Lilli prompts will lead to a improvement of XX% in accuracy compared to the current GPT Turbo 3.5 model we currently have on Lilli)

Expected effect (optional): Describe what is the expected outcome of the proposed experiment.

Risky Assumptions to mitigate (optional): Define any risky assumptions we should focus when doing the experiment.

Specific model/framework (optional): Describe any model, frameworks or tools that you want to be tested on this experiment.

Success Metrics: Describe what are the main measurable metrics that will be used to evaluate the outcomes of the experiment. This metrics will be the guide to observe, quantify, and analyze the effects of the experimental interventions we will be running.

Learning goal: Define here what is that your team hope to learn from the experiment.

Scope
TBD

Team
Please provide the resources that you plan to align to this experiment, their capacity and allocation

Timeline

- Please provide when your team will be ready to start the 
  experiment
- Please provide when you expect the final end result of the requested experiment

Dataset (optional)
- Please provide any dataset or important information that can 
  help on the experiment.

Additional Information (optional)
Please feel free to share any additional information, documents, attachments and comments that you believe are going to be useful when doing the experiment.
column609:
Description

[Use gherkin syntax to describe the user story. e.g., As a user, I want to automatically format the alignment on my slide so that I donâ€™t have to manually space objects and shapes, saving time and effort]
â€¢	context

Technical Implementation Details
[Describe relevant technical details such as Lilliâ€™s components modified within the scope of this story. E.g., Share new request and response examples for universal search API, explain the technical points changed in Reranker.]

Acceptance criteria
Please see acceptance criteria reference examples below. The QA team expects POs to provide an acceptance criteria as part of the story template.
[Example]
â€¢	[ ] The user can prompt Lilli to apply alignment formatting on their current slide
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations are automatically applied
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations adhere to McKinsey One Firm guidelines
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations do not take more than 10 seconds to be applied]
â€¢	[ ] Data-specific requirements (Data Acceptance Criteria)
â€¢	[ ] Functional requirements
â€¢	[ ] Quality benchmarks

Required inputs for QA to start
Use cases
[User diagrams, text and/or other representations to explain how this story will be used by end users, including benchmark results, leveraging expert inputs as needed]
[Optional field incase specific use cases different form ones described in Description exist]

Sample Prompt and Expected Results
[List a sample of prompts adequate to use and resulting outputs]

Dependencies and Feature/Product Risk
[List of as-is features that can be potentially impacted as a result of this story implementation]
[This is to ensure regression testing for story covers features that might be impacted]
[E.g., New flag implemented to manager parsing version through unleash that have impact in the visibility of the recommended icon feature of know docs.]
Data Ingested (when applicable)
[Identify the list of new data ingested]

 - Visuals
More info: https://mckinsey.ent.box.com/notes/344445380487
column884:
Overview:
Provide a brief summary of the project or request, including the main focus and improvement goals.

Objective and Key Result:
Objective: State the primary goal of the project
Key Result: List measurable outcomes that indicate success. Describe what impact will this change bring.

Problem Statement:
Describe the current situation and challenges and why is the change needed. Provide any data to support this statement if available.

column606:
Description

[Provide a concise overview of the bug including what functionality is affected]

Frequency of occurrence
[You can indicate whether the bug occurs - always, sometimes, or provide a frequency percentages with the number of occurrences relative to the total test executions for that scenario]

Environment
[identify the environment where this issue was identified]

Steps to replicate
[Insert by order all the steps that trigger the bug to be possible for any person to replicate]

Actual result
[Describe the behavior that you observed not considered the expected one]

Expected results
[When possible, mention the notion story id where the expected result is described]

Evidences
[Logs from Splunk+ Chat ID + UI Lilli Screenshots should be attached]

column608:
Experiment Summary

Title: Short text to describe your experiment.

Requesting Team: Please insert here your Lilli team name.

Main Stakeholders: List here the main stakeholders we should maintain informed during the experiment

Problem Definition: Please define the core problem or challenge that the proposed experiment seeks to address based on the end-user perspective.

Additional Context / Background information (optional): Include here any relevant theories or prior research
ðŸ”¬
    
Experiment
                          
Experiment Objectives
Main hypothesis: Please define the hypothesis (es) that will be tested through the proposed experiment. There should be clear a statement of the assumption that will happen when we test an experiment. î‚Example of hypothesis: Using Knowledge Graph when adding memory to Lilli prompts will lead to a improvement of XX% in accuracy compared to the current GPT Turbo 3.5 model we currently have on Lilli)

Expected effect (optional): Describe what is the expected outcome of the proposed experiment.

Risky Assumptions to mitigate (optional): Define any risky assumptions we should focus when doing the experiment.

Specific model/framework (optional): Describe any model, frameworks or tools that you want to be tested on this experiment.

Success Metrics: Describe what are the main measurable metrics that will be used to evaluate the outcomes of the experiment. This metrics will be the guide to observe, quantify, and analyze the effects of the experimental interventions we will be running.

Learning goal: Define here what is that your team hope to learn from the experiment.

Scope
TBD

Team
Please provide the resources that you plan to align to this experiment, their capacity and allocation

Timeline

- Please provide when your team will be ready to start the 
  experiment
- Please provide when you expect the final end result of the requested experiment

Dataset (optional)
- Please provide any dataset or important information that can 
  help on the experiment.

Additional Information (optional)
Please feel free to share any additional information, documents, attachments and comments that you believe are going to be useful when doing the experiment.
column609:
Description

[Use gherkin syntax to describe the user story. e.g., As a user, I want to automatically format the alignment on my slide so that I donâ€™t have to manually space objects and shapes, saving time and effort]
â€¢	context

Technical Implementation Details
[Describe relevant technical details such as Lilliâ€™s components modified within the scope of this story. E.g., Share new request and response examples for universal search API, explain the technical points changed in Reranker.]

Acceptance criteria
Please see acceptance criteria reference examples below. The QA team expects POs to provide an acceptance criteria as part of the story template.
[Example]
â€¢	[ ] The user can prompt Lilli to apply alignment formatting on their current slide
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations are automatically applied
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations adhere to McKinsey One Firm guidelines
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations do not take more than 10 seconds to be applied]
â€¢	[ ] Data-specific requirements (Data Acceptance Criteria)
â€¢	[ ] Functional requirements
â€¢	[ ] Quality benchmarks

Required inputs for QA to start
Use cases
[User diagrams, text and/or other representations to explain how this story will be used by end users, including benchmark results, leveraging expert inputs as needed]
[Optional field incase specific use cases different form ones described in Description exist]

Sample Prompt and Expected Results
[List a sample of prompts adequate to use and resulting outputs]

Dependencies and Feature/Product Risk
[List of as-is features that can be potentially impacted as a result of this story implementation]
[This is to ensure regression testing for story covers features that might be impacted]
[E.g., New flag implemented to manager parsing version through unleash that have impact in the visibility of the recommended icon feature of know docs.]
Data Ingested (when applicable)
[Identify the list of new data ingested]

Experiment Summary

Title: Short text to describe your experiment.

Requesting Team: Please insert here your Lilli team name.

Main Stakeholders: List here the main stakeholders we should maintain informed during the experiment

Problem Definition: Please define the core problem or challenge that the proposed experiment seeks to address based on the end-user perspective.

Additional Context / Background information (optional): Include here any relevant theories or prior research
ðŸ”¬
    
Experiment
                          
Experiment Objectives
Main hypothesis: Please define the hypothesis (es) that will be tested through the proposed experiment. There should be clear a statement of the assumption that will happen when we test an experiment. î‚Example of hypothesis: Using Knowledge Graph when adding memory to Lilli prompts will lead to a improvement of XX% in accuracy compared to the current GPT Turbo 3.5 model we currently have on Lilli)

Expected effect (optional): Describe what is the expected outcome of the proposed experiment.

Risky Assumptions to mitigate (optional): Define any risky assumptions we should focus when doing the experiment.

Specific model/framework (optional): Describe any model, frameworks or tools that you want to be tested on this experiment.

Success Metrics: Describe what are the main measurable metrics that will be used to evaluate the outcomes of the experiment. This metrics will be the guide to observe, quantify, and analyze the effects of the experimental interventions we will be running.

Learning goal: Define here what is that your team hope to learn from the experiment.

Scope
TBD

Team
Please provide the resources that you plan to align to this experiment, their capacity and allocation

Timeline

- Please provide when your team will be ready to start the 
  experiment
- Please provide when you expect the final end result of the requested experiment

Dataset (optional)
- Please provide any dataset or important information that can 
  help on the experiment.

Additional Information (optional)
Please feel free to share any additional information, documents, attachments and comments that you believe are going to be useful when doing the experiment.
column609:
Description

[Use gherkin syntax to describe the user story. e.g., As a user, I want to automatically format the alignment on my slide so that I donâ€™t have to manually space objects and shapes, saving time and effort]
â€¢	context

Technical Implementation Details
[Describe relevant technical details such as Lilliâ€™s components modified within the scope of this story. E.g., Share new request and response examples for universal search API, explain the technical points changed in Reranker.]

Acceptance criteria
Please see acceptance criteria reference examples below. The QA team expects POs to provide an acceptance criteria as part of the story template.
[Example]
â€¢	[ ] The user can prompt Lilli to apply alignment formatting on their current slide
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations are automatically applied
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations adhere to McKinsey One Firm guidelines
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations do not take more than 10 seconds to be applied]
â€¢	[ ] Data-specific requirements (Data Acceptance Criteria)
â€¢	[ ] Functional requirements
â€¢	[ ] Quality benchmarks

Required inputs for QA to start
Use cases
[User diagrams, text and/or other representations to explain how this story will be used by end users, including benchmark results, leveraging expert inputs as needed]
[Optional field incase specific use cases different form ones described in Description exist]

Sample Prompt and Expected Results
[List a sample of prompts adequate to use and resulting outputs]

Dependencies and Feature/Product Risk
[List of as-is features that can be potentially impacted as a result of this story implementation]
[This is to ensure regression testing for story covers features that might be impacted]
[E.g., New flag implemented to manager parsing version through unleash that have impact in the visibility of the recommended icon feature of know docs.]
Data Ingested (when applicable)
[Identify the list of new data ingested]

Experiment Summary

Title: Short text to describe your experiment.

Requesting Team: Please insert here your Lilli team name.

Main Stakeholders: List here the main stakeholders we should maintain informed during the experiment

Problem Definition: Please define the core problem or challenge that the proposed experiment seeks to address based on the end-user perspective.

Additional Context / Background information (optional): Include here any relevant theories or prior research
ðŸ”¬
    
Experiment
                          
Experiment Objectives
Main hypothesis: Please define the hypothesis (es) that will be tested through the proposed experiment. There should be clear a statement of the assumption that will happen when we test an experiment. î‚Example of hypothesis: Using Knowledge Graph when adding memory to Lilli prompts will lead to a improvement of XX% in accuracy compared to the current GPT Turbo 3.5 model we currently have on Lilli)

Expected effect (optional): Describe what is the expected outcome of the proposed experiment.

Risky Assumptions to mitigate (optional): Define any risky assumptions we should focus when doing the experiment.

Specific model/framework (optional): Describe any model, frameworks or tools that you want to be tested on this experiment.

Success Metrics: Describe what are the main measurable metrics that will be used to evaluate the outcomes of the experiment. This metrics will be the guide to observe, quantify, and analyze the effects of the experimental interventions we will be running.

Learning goal: Define here what is that your team hope to learn from the experiment.

Scope
TBD

Team
Please provide the resources that you plan to align to this experiment, their capacity and allocation

Timeline

- Please provide when your team will be ready to start the 
  experiment
- Please provide when you expect the final end result of the requested experiment

Dataset (optional)
- Please provide any dataset or important information that can 
  help on the experiment.

Additional Information (optional)
Please feel free to share any additional information, documents, attachments and comments that you believe are going to be useful when doing the experiment.

Description

[Use gherkin syntax to describe the user story. e.g., As a user, I want to automatically format the alignment on my slide so that I donâ€™t have to manually space objects and shapes, saving time and effort]
â€¢	context

Technical Implementation Details
[Describe relevant technical details such as Lilliâ€™s components modified within the scope of this story. E.g., Share new request and response examples for universal search API, explain the technical points changed in Reranker.]

Acceptance criteria
Please see acceptance criteria reference examples below. The QA team expects POs to provide an acceptance criteria as part of the story template.
[Example]
â€¢	[ ] The user can prompt Lilli to apply alignment formatting on their current slide
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations are automatically applied
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations adhere to McKinsey One Firm guidelines
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations do not take more than 10 seconds to be applied]
â€¢	[ ] Data-specific requirements (Data Acceptance Criteria)
â€¢	[ ] Functional requirements
â€¢	[ ] Quality benchmarks

Required inputs for QA to start
Use cases
[User diagrams, text and/or other representations to explain how this story will be used by end users, including benchmark results, leveraging expert inputs as needed]
[Optional field incase specific use cases different form ones described in Description exist]

Sample Prompt and Expected Results
[List a sample of prompts adequate to use and resulting outputs]

Dependencies and Feature/Product Risk
[List of as-is features that can be potentially impacted as a result of this story implementation]
[This is to ensure regression testing for story covers features that might be impacted]
[E.g., New flag implemented to manager parsing version through unleash that have impact in the visibility of the recommended icon feature of know docs.]

column608:
Experiment Summary

Title: Short text to describe your experiment.

Requesting Team: Please insert here your Lilli team name.

Main Stakeholders: List here the main stakeholders we should maintain informed during the experiment

Problem Definition: Please define the core problem or challenge that the proposed experiment seeks to address based on the end-user perspective.

Additional Context / Background information (optional): Include here any relevant theories or prior research
ðŸ”¬
    
Experiment
                          
Experiment Objectives
Main hypothesis: Please define the hypothesis (es) that will be tested through the proposed experiment. There should be clear a statement of the assumption that will happen when we test an experiment. î‚Example of hypothesis: Using Knowledge Graph when adding memory to Lilli prompts will lead to a improvement of XX% in accuracy compared to the current GPT Turbo 3.5 model we currently have on Lilli)

Expected effect (optional): Describe what is the expected outcome of the proposed experiment.

Risky Assumptions to mitigate (optional): Define any risky assumptions we should focus when doing the experiment.

Specific model/framework (optional): Describe any model, frameworks or tools that you want to be tested on this experiment.

Success Metrics: Describe what are the main measurable metrics that will be used to evaluate the outcomes of the experiment. This metrics will be the guide to observe, quantify, and analyze the effects of the experimental interventions we will be running.

Learning goal: Define here what is that your team hope to learn from the experiment.

Scope
TBD

Team
Please provide the resources that you plan to align to this experiment, their capacity and allocation

Timeline

- Please provide when your team will be ready to start the 
  experiment
- Please provide when you expect the final end result of the requested experiment

Dataset (optional)
- Please provide any dataset or important information that can 
  help on the experiment.

Additional Information (optional)
Please feel free to share any additional information, documents, attachments and comments that you believe are going to be useful when doing the experiment.
column609:
Description

[Use gherkin syntax to describe the user story. e.g., As a user, I want to automatically format the alignment on my slide so that I donâ€™t have to manually space objects and shapes, saving time and effort]
â€¢	context

Technical Implementation Details
[Describe relevant technical details such as Lilliâ€™s components modified within the scope of this story. E.g., Share new request and response examples for universal search API, explain the technical points changed in Reranker.]

Acceptance criteria
Please see acceptance criteria reference examples below. The QA team expects POs to provide an acceptance criteria as part of the story template.
[Example]
â€¢	[ ] The user can prompt Lilli to apply alignment formatting on their current slide
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations are automatically applied
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations adhere to McKinsey One Firm guidelines
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations do not take more than 10 seconds to be applied]
â€¢	[ ] Data-specific requirements (Data Acceptance Criteria)
â€¢	[ ] Functional requirements
â€¢	[ ] Quality benchmarks

Required inputs for QA to start
Use cases
[User diagrams, text and/or other representations to explain how this story will be used by end users, including benchmark results, leveraging expert inputs as needed]
[Optional field incase specific use cases different form ones described in Description exist]

Sample Prompt and Expected Results
[List a sample of prompts adequate to use and resulting outputs]

Dependencies and Feature/Product Risk
[List of as-is features that can be potentially impacted as a result of this story implementation]
[This is to ensure regression testing for story covers features that might be impacted]
[E.g., New flag implemented to manager parsing version through unleash that have impact in the visibility of the recommended icon feature of know docs.]
Data Ingested (when applicable)
[Identify the list of new data ingested]

There should be clear a statement of the assumption that will happen when we test an experiment. î‚Example of hypothesis: Using Knowledge Graph when adding memory to Lilli prompts will lead to a improvement of XX% in accuracy compared to the current GPT Turbo 3.5 model we currently have on Lilli)

Risky Assumptions to mitigate (optional): Define any risky assumptions we should focus when doing the experiment.

Description

[Use gherkin syntax to describe the user story. e.g., As a user, I want to automatically format the alignment on my slide so that I donâ€™t have to manually space objects and shapes, saving time and effort]
â€¢	context

Technical Implementation Details
[Describe relevant technical details such as Lilliâ€™s components modified within the scope of this story. E.g., Share new request and response examples for universal search API, explain the technical points changed in Reranker.]

Acceptance criteria
Please see acceptance criteria reference examples below. The QA team expects POs to provide an acceptance criteria as part of the story template.
[Example]
â€¢	[ ] The user can prompt Lilli to apply alignment formatting on their current slide
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations are automatically applied
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations adhere to McKinsey One Firm guidelines
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations do not take more than 10 seconds to be applied]
â€¢	[ ] Data-specific requirements (Data Acceptance Criteria)
â€¢	[ ] Functional requirements
â€¢	[ ] Quality benchmarks

column606:
Description

[Provide a concise overview of the bug including what functionality is affected]

Frequency of occurrence
[You can indicate whether the bug occurs - always, sometimes, or provide a frequency percentages with the number of occurrences relative to the total test executions for that scenario]

Environment
[identify the environment where this issue was identified]

Steps to replicate
[Insert by order all the steps that trigger the bug to be possible for any person to replicate]

Actual result
[Describe the behavior that you observed not considered the expected one]

Expected results
[When possible, mention the notion story id where the expected result is described]

Evidences
[Logs from Splunk+ Chat ID + UI Lilli Screenshots should be attached]

column608:
Experiment Summary

Title: Short text to describe your experiment.

Requesting Team: Please insert here your Lilli team name.

Main Stakeholders: List here the main stakeholders we should maintain informed during the experiment

Problem Definition: Please define the core problem or challenge that the proposed experiment seeks to address based on the end-user perspective.

Additional Context / Background information (optional): Include here any relevant theories or prior research
ðŸ”¬
    
Experiment
                          
Experiment Objectives
Main hypothesis: Please define the hypothesis (es) that will be tested through the proposed experiment. There should be clear a statement of the assumption that will happen when we test an experiment. î‚Example of hypothesis: Using Knowledge Graph when adding memory to Lilli prompts will lead to a improvement of XX% in accuracy compared to the current GPT Turbo 3.5 model we currently have on Lilli)

Expected effect (optional): Describe what is the expected outcome of the proposed experiment.

Risky Assumptions to mitigate (optional): Define any risky assumptions we should focus when doing the experiment.

Specific model/framework (optional): Describe any model, frameworks or tools that you want to be tested on this experiment.

Success Metrics: Describe what are the main measurable metrics that will be used to evaluate the outcomes of the experiment. This metrics will be the guide to observe, quantify, and analyze the effects of the experimental interventions we will be running.

Learning goal: Define here what is that your team hope to learn from the experiment.

Scope
TBD

Team
Please provide the resources that you plan to align to this experiment, their capacity and allocation

Timeline

- Please provide when your team will be ready to start the 
  experiment
- Please provide when you expect the final end result of the requested experiment

Dataset (optional)
- Please provide any dataset or important information that can 
  help on the experiment.

Additional Information (optional)
Please feel free to share any additional information, documents, attachments and comments that you believe are going to be useful when doing the experiment.
column609:
Description

[Use gherkin syntax to describe the user story. e.g., As a user, I want to automatically format the alignment on my slide so that I donâ€™t have to manually space objects and shapes, saving time and effort]
â€¢	context

Technical Implementation Details
[Describe relevant technical details such as Lilliâ€™s components modified within the scope of this story. E.g., Share new request and response examples for universal search API, explain the technical points changed in Reranker.]

Acceptance criteria
Please see acceptance criteria reference examples below. The QA team expects POs to provide an acceptance criteria as part of the story template.
[Example]
â€¢	[ ] The user can prompt Lilli to apply alignment formatting on their current slide
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations are automatically applied
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations adhere to McKinsey One Firm guidelines
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations do not take more than 10 seconds to be applied]
â€¢	[ ] Data-specific requirements (Data Acceptance Criteria)
â€¢	[ ] Functional requirements
â€¢	[ ] Quality benchmarks

Required inputs for QA to start
Use cases
[User diagrams, text and/or other representations to explain how this story will be used by end users, including benchmark results, leveraging expert inputs as needed]
[Optional field incase specific use cases different form ones described in Description exist]

Sample Prompt and Expected Results
[List a sample of prompts adequate to use and resulting outputs]

Dependencies and Feature/Product Risk
[List of as-is features that can be potentially impacted as a result of this story implementation]
[This is to ensure regression testing for story covers features that might be impacted]
[E.g., New flag implemented to manager parsing version through unleash that have impact in the visibility of the recommended icon feature of know docs.]
Data Ingested (when applicable)
[Identify the list of new data ingested]

Experiment Summary

Title: Short text to describe your experiment.

Requesting Team: Please insert here your Lilli team name.

Main Stakeholders: List here the main stakeholders we should maintain informed during the experiment

Problem Definition: Please define the core problem or challenge that the proposed experiment seeks to address based on the end-user perspective.

Additional Context / Background information (optional): Include here any relevant theories or prior research
ðŸ”¬
    
Experiment
                          
Experiment Objectives
Main hypothesis: Please define the hypothesis (es) that will be tested through the proposed experiment. There should be clear a statement of the assumption that will happen when we test an experiment. î‚Example of hypothesis: Using Knowledge Graph when adding memory to Lilli prompts will lead to a improvement of XX% in accuracy compared to the current GPT Turbo 3.5 model we currently have on Lilli)

Expected effect (optional): Describe what is the expected outcome of the proposed experiment.

Risky Assumptions to mitigate (optional): Define any risky assumptions we should focus when doing the experiment.

Specific model/framework (optional): Describe any model, frameworks or tools that you want to be tested on this experiment.

Success Metrics: Describe what are the main measurable metrics that will be used to evaluate the outcomes of the experiment. This metrics will be the guide to observe, quantify, and analyze the effects of the experimental interventions we will be running.

Learning goal: Define here what is that your team hope to learn from the experiment.

Scope
TBD

Team
Please provide the resources that you plan to align to this experiment, their capacity and allocation

Timeline

- Please provide when your team will be ready to start the 
  experiment
- Please provide when you expect the final end result of the requested experiment

Dataset (optional)
- Please provide any dataset or important information that can 
  help on the experiment.

Additional Information (optional)
Please feel free to share any additional information, documents, attachments and comments that you believe are going to be useful when doing the experiment.
column609:
Description

[Use gherkin syntax to describe the user story. e.g., As a user, I want to automatically format the alignment on my slide so that I donâ€™t have to manually space objects and shapes, saving time and effort]
â€¢	context

Technical Implementation Details
[Describe relevant technical details such as Lilliâ€™s components modified within the scope of this story. E.g., Share new request and response examples for universal search API, explain the technical points changed in Reranker.]

Acceptance criteria
Please see acceptance criteria reference examples below. The QA team expects POs to provide an acceptance criteria as part of the story template.
[Example]
â€¢	[ ] The user can prompt Lilli to apply alignment formatting on their current slide
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations are automatically applied
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations adhere to McKinsey One Firm guidelines
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations do not take more than 10 seconds to be applied]
â€¢	[ ] Data-specific requirements (Data Acceptance Criteria)
â€¢	[ ] Functional requirements
â€¢	[ ] Quality benchmarks

Required inputs for QA to start
Use cases
[User diagrams, text and/or other representations to explain how this story will be used by end users, including benchmark results, leveraging expert inputs as needed]
[Optional field incase specific use cases different form ones described in Description exist]

Sample Prompt and Expected Results
[List a sample of prompts adequate to use and resulting outputs]

Dependencies and Feature/Product Risk
[List of as-is features that can be potentially impacted as a result of this story implementation]
[This is to ensure regression testing for story covers features that might be impacted]
[E.g., New flag implemented to manager parsing version through unleash that have impact in the visibility of the recommended icon feature of know docs.]
Data Ingested (when applicable)
[Identify the list of new data ingested]

â€¢	context

Technical Implementation Details
[Describe relevant technical details such as Lilliâ€™s components modified within the scope of this story. E.g., Share new request and response examples for universal search API, explain the technical points changed in Reranker.]

Acceptance criteria
Please see acceptance criteria reference examples below. The QA team expects POs to provide an acceptance criteria as part of the story template.
[Example]
â€¢	[ ] The user can prompt Lilli to apply alignment formatting on their current slide
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations are automatically applied
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations adhere to McKinsey One Firm guidelines
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations do not take more than 10 seconds to be applied]
â€¢	[ ] Data-specific requirements (Data Acceptance Criteria)
â€¢	[ ] Functional requirements
â€¢	[ ] Quality benchmarks

Required inputs for QA to start
Use cases
[User diagrams, text and/or other representations to explain how this story will be used by end users, including benchmark results, leveraging expert inputs as needed]
[Optional field incase specific use cases different form ones described in Description exist]

Sample Prompt and Expected Results
[List a sample of prompts adequate to use and resulting outputs]

Dependencies and Feature/Product Risk
[List of as-is features that can be potentially impacted as a result of this story implementation]
[This is to ensure regression testing for story covers features that might be impacted]
[E.g., New flag implemented to manager parsing version through unleash that have impact in the visibility of the recommended icon feature of know docs.]
Data Ingested (when applicable)
[Identify the list of new data ingested]

Experiment Summary

Title: Short text to describe your experiment.

Requesting Team: Please insert here your Lilli team name.

Main Stakeholders: List here the main stakeholders we should maintain informed during the experiment

Problem Definition: Please define the core problem or challenge that the proposed experiment seeks to address based on the end-user perspective.

Additional Context / Background information (optional): Include here any relevant theories or prior research
ðŸ”¬
    
Experiment
                          
Experiment Objectives
Main hypothesis: Please define the hypothesis (es) that will be tested through the proposed experiment. There should be clear a statement of the assumption that will happen when we test an experiment. î‚Example of hypothesis: Using Knowledge Graph when adding memory to Lilli prompts will lead to a improvement of XX% in accuracy compared to the current GPT Turbo 3.5 model we currently have on Lilli)

Expected effect (optional): Describe what is the expected outcome of the proposed experiment.

Risky Assumptions to mitigate (optional): Define any risky assumptions we should focus when doing the experiment.

Specific model/framework (optional): Describe any model, frameworks or tools that you want to be tested on this experiment.

Success Metrics: Describe what are the main measurable metrics that will be used to evaluate the outcomes of the experiment. This metrics will be the guide to observe, quantify, and analyze the effects of the experimental interventions we will be running.

Learning goal: Define here what is that your team hope to learn from the experiment.

Scope
TBD

Team
Please provide the resources that you plan to align to this experiment, their capacity and allocation

Timeline

- Please provide when your team will be ready to start the 
  experiment
- Please provide when you expect the final end result of the requested experiment

Dataset (optional)
- Please provide any dataset or important information that can 
  help on the experiment.

Additional Information (optional)
Please feel free to share any additional information, documents, attachments and comments that you believe are going to be useful when doing the experiment.

Description

[Use gherkin syntax to describe the user story. e.g., As a user, I want to automatically format the alignment on my slide so that I donâ€™t have to manually space objects and shapes, saving time and effort]
â€¢	context

Technical Implementation Details
[Describe relevant technical details such as Lilliâ€™s components modified within the scope of this story. E.g., Share new request and response examples for universal search API, explain the technical points changed in Reranker.]

Acceptance criteria
Please see acceptance criteria reference examples below. The QA team expects POs to provide an acceptance criteria as part of the story template.
[Example]
â€¢	[ ] The user can prompt Lilli to apply alignment formatting on their current slide
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations are automatically applied
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations adhere to McKinsey One Firm guidelines
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations do not take more than 10 seconds to be applied]
â€¢	[ ] Data-specific requirements (Data Acceptance Criteria)
â€¢	[ ] Functional requirements
â€¢	[ ] Quality benchmarks

Required inputs for QA to start
Use cases

[Optional field incase specific use cases different form ones described in Description exist]

Sample Prompt and Expected Results
[List a sample of prompts adequate to use and resulting outputs]

Dependencies and Feature/Product Risk
[List of as-is features that can be potentially impacted as a result of this story implementation]
[This is to ensure regression testing for story covers features that might be impacted]
[E.g., New flag implemented to manager parsing version through unleash that have impact in the visibility of the recommended icon feature of know docs.]

Requesting Team: Please insert here your Lilli team name.

Main Stakeholders: List here the main stakeholders we should maintain informed during the experiment

Problem Definition: Please define the core problem or challenge that the proposed experiment seeks to address based on the end-user perspective.

Additional Context / Background information (optional): Include here any relevant theories or prior research
ðŸ”¬
    
Experiment
                          
Experiment Objectives
Main hypothesis: Please define the hypothesis (es) that will be tested through the proposed experiment. There should be clear a statement of the assumption that will happen when we test an experiment. î‚Example of hypothesis: Using Knowledge Graph when adding memory to Lilli prompts will lead to a improvement of XX% in accuracy compared to the current GPT Turbo 3.5 model we currently have on Lilli)

Expected effect (optional): Describe what is the expected outcome of the proposed experiment.

Risky Assumptions to mitigate (optional): Define any risky assumptions we should focus when doing the experiment.

Specific model/framework (optional): Describe any model, frameworks or tools that you want to be tested on this experiment.

Success Metrics: Describe what are the main measurable metrics that will be used to evaluate the outcomes of the experiment. This metrics will be the guide to observe, quantify, and analyze the effects of the experimental interventions we will be running.

Learning goal: Define here what is that your team hope to learn from the experiment.

Scope
TBD

Team
Please provide the resources that you plan to align to this experiment, their capacity and allocation

Timeline

- Please provide when your team will be ready to start the 
  experiment
- Please provide when you expect the final end result of the requested experiment

Dataset (optional)
- Please provide any dataset or important information that can 
  help on the experiment.

Additional Information (optional)
Please feel free to share any additional information, documents, attachments and comments that you believe are going to be useful when doing the experiment.
column609:
Description

[Use gherkin syntax to describe the user story. e.g., As a user, I want to automatically format the alignment on my slide so that I donâ€™t have to manually space objects and shapes, saving time and effort]
â€¢	context

Technical Implementation Details
[Describe relevant technical details such as Lilliâ€™s components modified within the scope of this story. E.g., Share new request and response examples for universal search API, explain the technical points changed in Reranker.]

Acceptance criteria
Please see acceptance criteria reference examples below. The QA team expects POs to provide an acceptance criteria as part of the story template.
[Example]
â€¢	[ ] The user can prompt Lilli to apply alignment formatting on their current slide
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations are automatically applied
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations adhere to McKinsey One Firm guidelines
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations do not take more than 10 seconds to be applied]
â€¢	[ ] Data-specific requirements (Data Acceptance Criteria)
â€¢	[ ] Functional requirements
â€¢	[ ] Quality benchmarks

Required inputs for QA to start
Use cases
[User diagrams, text and/or other representations to explain how this story will be used by end users, including benchmark results, leveraging expert inputs as needed]
[Optional field incase specific use cases different form ones described in Description exist]

Sample Prompt and Expected Results
[List a sample of prompts adequate to use and resulting outputs]

Dependencies and Feature/Product Risk
[List of as-is features that can be potentially impacted as a result of this story implementation]
[This is to ensure regression testing for story covers features that might be impacted]
[E.g., New flag implemented to manager parsing version through unleash that have impact in the visibility of the recommended icon feature of know docs.]
Data Ingested (when applicable)
[Identify the list of new data ingested]

[identify the environment where this issue was identified]

[Insert by order all the steps that trigger the bug to be possible for any person to replicate]

Actual result
[Describe the behavior that you observed not considered the expected one]

Expected results
[When possible, mention the notion story id where the expected result is described]

Evidences
[Logs from Splunk+ Chat ID + UI Lilli Screenshots should be attached]

column608:
Experiment Summary

Title: Short text to describe your experiment.

Requesting Team: Please insert here your Lilli team name.

Main Stakeholders: List here the main stakeholders we should maintain informed during the experiment

Problem Definition: Please define the core problem or challenge that the proposed experiment seeks to address based on the end-user perspective.

Additional Context / Background information (optional): Include here any relevant theories or prior research
ðŸ”¬
    
Experiment
                          
Experiment Objectives
Main hypothesis: Please define the hypothesis (es) that will be tested through the proposed experiment. There should be clear a statement of the assumption that will happen when we test an experiment. î‚Example of hypothesis: Using Knowledge Graph when adding memory to Lilli prompts will lead to a improvement of XX% in accuracy compared to the current GPT Turbo 3.5 model we currently have on Lilli)

Expected effect (optional): Describe what is the expected outcome of the proposed experiment.

Risky Assumptions to mitigate (optional): Define any risky assumptions we should focus when doing the experiment.

Specific model/framework (optional): Describe any model, frameworks or tools that you want to be tested on this experiment.

Success Metrics: Describe what are the main measurable metrics that will be used to evaluate the outcomes of the experiment. This metrics will be the guide to observe, quantify, and analyze the effects of the experimental interventions we will be running.

Learning goal: Define here what is that your team hope to learn from the experiment.

Scope
TBD

Team
Please provide the resources that you plan to align to this experiment, their capacity and allocation

Timeline

- Please provide when your team will be ready to start the 
  experiment
- Please provide when you expect the final end result of the requested experiment

Dataset (optional)
- Please provide any dataset or important information that can 
  help on the experiment.

Additional Information (optional)
Please feel free to share any additional information, documents, attachments and comments that you believe are going to be useful when doing the experiment.
column609:
Description

[Use gherkin syntax to describe the user story. e.g., As a user, I want to automatically format the alignment on my slide so that I donâ€™t have to manually space objects and shapes, saving time and effort]
â€¢	context

Technical Implementation Details
[Describe relevant technical details such as Lilliâ€™s components modified within the scope of this story. E.g., Share new request and response examples for universal search API, explain the technical points changed in Reranker.]

Acceptance criteria
Please see acceptance criteria reference examples below. The QA team expects POs to provide an acceptance criteria as part of the story template.
[Example]
â€¢	[ ] The user can prompt Lilli to apply alignment formatting on their current slide
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations are automatically applied
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations adhere to McKinsey One Firm guidelines
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations do not take more than 10 seconds to be applied]
â€¢	[ ] Data-specific requirements (Data Acceptance Criteria)
â€¢	[ ] Functional requirements
â€¢	[ ] Quality benchmarks

Required inputs for QA to start
Use cases
[User diagrams, text and/or other representations to explain how this story will be used by end users, including benchmark results, leveraging expert inputs as needed]
[Optional field incase specific use cases different form ones described in Description exist]

Sample Prompt and Expected Results
[List a sample of prompts adequate to use and resulting outputs]

Dependencies and Feature/Product Risk
[List of as-is features that can be potentially impacted as a result of this story implementation]
[This is to ensure regression testing for story covers features that might be impacted]
[E.g., New flag implemented to manager parsing version through unleash that have impact in the visibility of the recommended icon feature of know docs.]
Data Ingested (when applicable)
[Identify the list of new data ingested]

ðŸ”¬
    
Experiment
                          
Experiment Objectives
Main hypothesis: Please define the hypothesis (es) that will be tested through the proposed experiment. There should be clear a statement of the assumption that will happen when we test an experiment. î‚Example of hypothesis: Using Knowledge Graph when adding memory to Lilli prompts will lead to a improvement of XX% in accuracy compared to the current GPT Turbo 3.5 model we currently have on Lilli)

Expected effect (optional): Describe what is the expected outcome of the proposed experiment.

Risky Assumptions to mitigate (optional): Define any risky assumptions we should focus when doing the experiment.

Specific model/framework (optional): Describe any model, frameworks or tools that you want to be tested on this experiment.

Success Metrics: Describe what are the main measurable metrics that will be used to evaluate the outcomes of the experiment. This metrics will be the guide to observe, quantify, and analyze the effects of the experimental interventions we will be running.

Learning goal: Define here what is that your team hope to learn from the experiment.

column609:
Description

[Use gherkin syntax to describe the user story. e.g., As a user, I want to automatically format the alignment on my slide so that I donâ€™t have to manually space objects and shapes, saving time and effort]
â€¢	context

Technical Implementation Details
[Describe relevant technical details such as Lilliâ€™s components modified within the scope of this story. E.g., Share new request and response examples for universal search API, explain the technical points changed in Reranker.]

Acceptance criteria
Please see acceptance criteria reference examples below. The QA team expects POs to provide an acceptance criteria as part of the story template.
[Example]
â€¢	[ ] The user can prompt Lilli to apply alignment formatting on their current slide
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations are automatically applied
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations adhere to McKinsey One Firm guidelines
â€¢	[ ] The formatting recommendations do not take more than 10 seconds to be applied]
â€¢	[ ] Data-specific requirements (Data Acceptance Criteria)
â€¢	[ ] Functional requirements
â€¢	[ ] Quality benchmarks

Required inputs for QA to start
Use cases
[User diagrams, text and/or other representations to explain how this story will be used by end users, including benchmark results, leveraging expert inputs as needed]
[Optional field incase specific use cases different form ones described in Description exist]

Sample Prompt and Expected Results
[List a sample of prompts adequate to use and resulting outputs]

Dependencies and Feature/Product Risk
[List of as-is features that can be potentially impacted as a result of this story implementation]
[This is to ensure regression testing for story covers features that might be impacted]
[E.g., New flag implemented to manager parsing version through unleash that have impact in the visibility of the recommended icon feature of know docs.]
Data Ingested (when applicable)
[Identify the list of new data ingested]

Experiment Objectives
Main hypothesis: Please define the hypothesis (es) that will be tested through the proposed experiment. There should be clear a statement of the assumption that will happen when we test an experiment. î‚Example of hypothesis: Using Knowledge Graph when adding memory to Lilli prompts will lead to a improvement of XX% in accuracy compared to the current GPT Turbo 3.5 model we currently have on Lilli)

Expected effect (optional): Describe what is the expected outcome of the proposed experiment.

Risky Assumptions to mitigate (optional): Define any risky assumptions we should focus when doing the experiment.

Specific model/framework (optional): Describe any model, frameworks or tools that you want to be tested on this experiment.

There should be clear a statement of the assumption that will happen when we test an experiment. î‚Example of hypothesis: Using Knowledge Graph when adding memory to Lilli prompts will lead to a improvement of XX% in accuracy compared to the current GPT Turbo 3.5 model we currently have on Lilli)

Expected effect (optional): Describe what is the expected outcome of the proposed experiment.

Risky Assumptions to mitigate (optional): Define any risky assumptions we should focus when doing the experiment.

Specific model/framework (optional): Describe any model, frameworks or tools that you want to be tested on this experiment.

Success Metrics: Describe what are the main measurable metrics that will be used to evaluate the outcomes of the experiment. This metrics will be the guide to observe, quantify, and analyze the effects of the experimental interventions we will be running.

Learning goal: Define here what is that your team hope to learn from the experiment.

Scope
TBD

Team
Please provide the resources that you plan to align to this experiment, their capacity and allocation

Timeline

- Please provide when your team will be ready to start the 
  experiment
- Please provide when you expect the final end result of the requested experiment

Dataset (optional)
- Please provide any dataset or important information that can 
  help on the experiment.

Additional Information (optional)
Please feel free to share any additional information, documents, attachments and comments that you believe are going to be useful when doing the experiment.
